alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 12:47PM PST until January 04 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Advisory Continues through this Evening... .A weather system continues to bring snow showers to the mountains of interior NorCal. Snow levels have risen to above 6,000 feet this afternoon. Motorists are always advised to check with CalTrans on the latest road conditions and chain restrictions before embarking on mountain travel. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow occurring. Plan on slippery road conditions, including during the evening commute. Additional wet snow accumulations of up to two inches are expected at pass level. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada above 6,000 feet, including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass and Highway 50 over Echo Summit. * WHEN...Until 7 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for wet snow means periods of wet snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
